NFHL_FLD_ZONE.description: The flood hazard zone classification describes the level and type of flood risk assigned to the location based on FEMA floodplain mapping.

code_map.A: Areas subject to inundation by the 1-percent-annual-chance (100-year) flood where detailed hydraulic analyses are not provided.
code_map.AE: Areas subject to inundation by the 1-percent-annual-chance flood with base flood elevations determined through detailed hydraulic studies.
code_map.AO: Areas subject to shallow flooding with ponding or sheet flow, typically characterized by flood depths rather than water surface elevations.
code_map.AH: Areas subject to shallow flooding with ponding where base flood elevations are provided.
code_map.V: Coastal areas subject to inundation by the 1-percent-annual-chance flood with additional hazards from storm-induced wave action.
code_map.VE: Coastal areas subject to inundation by the 1-percent-annual-chance flood with wave action where base flood elevations are determined.
code_map.X: Areas outside the 1-percent-annual-chance floodplain, representing minimal or moderate flood hazard.
code_map.X (0.2%): Areas subject to inundation by the 0.2-percent-annual-chance (500-year) flood, representing low-probability flood hazard.
code_map.D: Areas where flood hazard has not been determined due to insufficient or unavailable data.

NFHL_SFHA.description: The indicator of Special Flood Hazard Area status describes whether the location is subject to a 1-percent-annual-chance (100-year) flood hazard.

code_map.T: The location lies within a Special Flood Hazard Area subject to a 1-percent-annual-chance flood event.
code_map.F: The location lies outside the Special Flood Hazard Area and is not subject to the 1-percent-annual-chance flood event.

NFHL_STATIC_BFE.description: The base flood elevation represents the estimated water surface height reached during a 1-percent-annual-chance (100-year) flood event, providing a quantitative measure of flood depth and hydraulic demand at the location.

NFHL_ZONE_SUBTYPE.description: The flood zone subtype provides a more specific categorical description of flood hazard conditions within the mapped flood zone, such as minimal, shallow, or coastal risk.
